comments:
If I define a filter such as 

<commonFilter
activeByDefault="true"
id="org.python.pydev.navigator.filters.hideNonPydevProjects"
description="Hide non pydev projects"
name="Hide non-Pydev Projects">

I get an error when selecting it on the filters dialog, but if I do it as:

<commonFilter
activeByDefault="true"
id="org.python.pydev.navigator.filters.hideNonPydevProjects"
description="%HideNonPydevProjects.description"
name="Hide non-Pydev Projects">

and then define the description in the plugin.properties:
HideNonPydevProjects.description=Hide non pydev projects

it works (if I don't define the description I get the same error... and the docs don't put it as required).


The error I get is:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument cannot be null
